Problem 2
```{r}
# read the data
homicide = read_csv("data/homicide-data.csv") %>% 
  mutate(city_state = str_c(city, ", ", state),
         solve_status = as.factor(ifelse(disposition == "Closed by arrest", 1, 0)),
         victim_age = as.numeric(victim_age)) %>% 
  filter(city_state != c("Dallas, TX", "Phoenix, AZ",  "Kansas City, MO", "Tulsa, AL") &
         victim_race == "White" | victim_race =="Black") %>% 
  drop_na()

homicide
```


```{r}
fit_logistic_MD = 
  homicide %>% 
  filter(city_state == "Baltimore, MD") %>% 
  glm(solve_status ~ victim_age + victim_race + victim_sex, data = ., family = binomial()) %>% 
  broom::tidy() %>% 
  mutate(OR = exp(estimate),
         lower_ci = OR - std.error*1.96,
         upper_ci = OR + std.error*1.96) %>%
  select(term, OR, lower_ci, upper_ci) %>% 
  filter(term == "victim_sexMale") %>% 
  knitr::kable(digits = 3) 


fit_logistic_MD
```

```{r}
fit_logistic = function(x) {
  
  result = homicide %>% 
  filter(city_state == x) %>% 
  glm(solve_status ~ victim_age + victim_race + victim_sex, data = ., family = binomial()) %>% 
  broom::tidy() %>% 
  mutate(OR = exp(estimate),
         lower_ci = OR - std.error*1.96,
         upper_ci = OR + std.error*1.96) %>%
  select(term, log_OR = estimate, OR, p.value,lower_ci, upper_ci) %>% 
  filter(term == "victim_sexMale") 
  
  result
  }
  
fit_logistic("Atlanta, GA")


odds_city_state = tibble(city_state = unique(homicide$city_state),
                         model = map(unique(homicide$city_state), fit_logistic)) %>% 
  unnest()
  
odds_city_state
```
